newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Pojistovna proposes rights issue.
newsitem.headline: Czech Pojistovna proposes rights issue.

text.p: The board of the Czech insurance group Ceska Pojistovna a.s. proposed a 1.137 billion crowns rights issue to be voted on at an extraordinary shareholders meeting on September 5, a statement said.

According to the statement published in the official Business Registry gazette, the board is proposing that shares with a 1,000 crown nominal value be offered to existing shareholders at 5,000 crowns per share.
The rights issue, if approved and fully subscribed would raise Pojistovna's basic capital to 3.412 billion crowns, the statement said.

Pojistovna's major shareholders include the private investment fund PPF, the banks Komercni Banka a.s., Investicni a Postovni Banka a.s., and Ceskoslovenska Obchodni Banka a.s., and the state-run National Property Fund.
